entry.title: Get started with ease using security workflows!
entry.summary: In-line with the other categories, workflows in the Security category will be recommended based on a repository's content.

entry.title: GitHub Advisory Database now open to community contributions
entry.summary: Anyone can now provide additional information to further the community’s understanding and awareness of security advisories.

entry.title: Code scanning finds more vulnerabilities using machine learning
entry.summary: Today we launched new code scanning analysis features powered by machine learning. The experimental analysis finds more of the most common types of vulnerabilities.

entry.title: Leveraging machine learning to find security vulnerabilities
entry.summary: A behind-the-scenes peek into the machine learning framework powering new code scanning security alerts.

entry.title: How to make the most out of a mentoring relationship
entry.summary: Tips from our developer advocates on how and why to find a mentor.

entry.title: Encoding and escaping untrusted data to prevent injection attacks
entry.summary: Practical tips on how to apply OWASP Top 10 Proactive Control C4.

entry.title: GitHub Enterprise Server 3.4 improves developer productivity and adds reusable workflows to CI/CD
entry.summary: The GitHub Enterprise Server 3.4 release candidate delivers enhancements to make life easier and more productive.

entry.title: The GitHub Stars in our eyes ⭐️
entry.summary: Over the past year, the GitHub Stars have made a tremendous impact in the community with their influence, inspiring and building communities and creating content to help everyone.

entry.title: Announcing the 2022 MLH Fellowship Cohort, powered by GitHub
entry.summary: The MLH Fellowship, powered by GitHub, is a 12-week internship alternative for aspiring software engineers. Meet the 2022 cohort!

entry.title: Include diagrams in your Markdown files with Mermaid
entry.summary: A picture tells a thousand words. Now you can quickly create and edit diagrams in markdown using words with Mermaid support in your Markdown files.
